alert.note: Alert for Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 3:03PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Caribou, northwestern Bannock, northeastern Power, central Bonneville and southeastern Bingham Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 302 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Firth to Fort Hall Eagle Lodge to near Fort Hall Buffalo Lodge to near Aberdeen. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pocatello, Blackfoot, Goshen, American Falls Reservoir, Chubbuck, Shelley, Firth, Fort Hall Buffalo Lodge, Rose, Fort Hall Eagle Lodge, Fort Hall Lincoln Creek Lodge, Fort Hall Townsite, Fort Hall Mount Putnam, Bone, Pocatello Airport, Fort Hall Putnam Lodge, Basalt, Cutthroat Trout Campground, Trail Creek Campground and Wapello. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
